ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: twisting troubles
ygData.msgSnippet: Give up my bard?  NEVER! ANyway I have a teenage daughter who plays and the computer is hers until 8:30 ... leaving me time to cook, shop, clean up (sort of)
ygData.messageBody:
Give up my bard? NEVER!

ANyway I have a teenage daughter who plays and the
computer is hers until 8:30 ... leaving me time to
cook, shop, clean up (sort of) and still play EQ;-)



--- "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...> wrote:
> Then switch to a rogue, you wont feel like your
> missing out on playtime!
> Not only that, but there are zones you can cross by
> hitting
> hide/sneak/autorun and then leaving your computer
> for an hour or two to play
> with the little ones. ;^)
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Bill Costlow [mailto:atlatyl@...]
> > Sent: Thursday, April 13, 2000 8:49 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: twisting troubles
> >
> >
> > --- "Webber, Jessica" <webber@...> wrote:
> >
> > > Fight one blue mob, sit,
> > > run downstairs & wash the dishes, run upstairs &
> > > check on HP, run downstairs
> > > & fold laundry, run upstairs, repeat from top...
> > >
> >
> > LOL! I am a single parent...this is the way I
> play
> > all the time!
> >
